paper_abstract: Valiant [L. Valiant, Completeness classes in algebra, in: Proc. 11th Annual ACM Symposium on the Theory of Computing, Atlanta. GA, 1979, pp. 249-261] proved that every polynomial of formula size e is a projection of the (e + 2) x (e + 2) determinant polynomial. We improve;''e + 2" to "e + I", also for a definition of formula size that does not count multiplications by constants as gates. Our proof imitates the "2e + 2" proof of von zur Gathen [J. von zur Gathen, Feasible arithmetic computations: Valiant's hypothesis, Journal of Symbolic Computation 4 (1987) 137-172], but uses different invariants and a tighter set of base cases. (c) 2006 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Improved construction for universality of determinant and permanent
